body_html:
:(. Sorry @freedomtan. There was an internal refactoring and I was hoping to get this change in first so that we'd have to do the refactoring, but looks like it didn't happen.

The context of the merge conflict is that all of the decode C++ implementations now are a single kernel (DecodeImage), because it was the case that too many people used decode_jpeg on images that were not jpegs; so now we have a single kernel that can decode all of them. However, the python code still has separate python functions. Let me know if you need any help making progress.

body:
:(.  Sorry @freedomtan.  There was an internal refactoring and I was hoping to get this change in first so that we'd have to do the refactoring, but looks like it didn't happen.

The context of the merge conflict is that all of the decode C++ implementations now are a single kernel (DecodeImage), because it was the case that too many people used decode_jpeg on images that were not jpegs; so now we have a single kernel that can decode all of them.  However, the python code still has separate python functions.  Let me know if you need any help making progress.
